imdb.title: The Big O
imdb.plot: In a futuristic city with lost memories, an expert negotiator fights threats to the city with the help of an android and his own giant robot.

episodes.title: Roger the Wanderer
episodes.plot: Roger and Dorothy battle against three foreign mechs when he takes a hit. Suddenly he finds himself 40 years in the past and living a different life, causing him to question his existence.

episodes.title: Negotiations with the Dead
episodes.plot: Kelly Fitzgerald hires Roger to protect her husband from an assassin. Rumors are the city Senate is killing anyone with knowledge of the past, so Roger and Dorothy begin their investigation.

episodes.title: Day of the Advent
episodes.plot: A strange object from the sky crashes into the city before it is recovered by the Paradigm organization. Roger is tasked with ascertaining the nature of the strange object.

episodes.title: Leviathan
episodes.plot: Schwarzwald threatens that he had discovered a powerful mech called the Leviathan. Roger scrambles to find him before he unleashes its power on the world.

episodes.title: The Greatest Villain
episodes.plot: Beck once again busts out of jail and captures Roger as part of a scheme. Copying Roger's face and voice, he commands the Big O to go on a rampage.

episodes.title: Eyewitness
episodes.plot: A serial killer is going around killing androids, prompting the government to put a new inspector on board. Roger begins his own investigation and runs into Angel.

episodes.title: Stripes
episodes.plot: Roger tries to understand his flashbacks.

episodes.title: The Third Big
episodes.plot: The Big O battles the Bonaparte when Roger realizes that Dorothy is in danger. He leaves the Big O to fend for itself as Angel confronts Alan, who is holding Dorothy hostage.

episodes.title: Hydra
episodes.plot: The military police starts capturing anyone accused of being an Union agent. Roger and his allies form an uneasy alliance with Vera to prevent something terrible from happening.

episodes.title: Twisted Memories
episodes.plot: Alan releases Beck from prison and orders him to rebuild the Big Fau. Roger attempts to track down Angel, who holds a dark secret.

episodes.title: The Big Fight
episodes.plot: A newly rebuilt Big Duo reappears and controlled by Alan. Roger opposed it in the Big O as a huge fight breaks out.

episodes.title: The War of the Paradigm City
episodes.plot: All out war begins as Union bombards the city with beams of light. Angel and Roger go to face Vera, who reveals the shocking truth about what happened forty years ago.

episodes.title: The Show Must Go On
episodes.plot: The police and every other survivor watch as the Big O and Big Fau begin their final clash. Who will be the ultimate victor and what will become of the city and all of its people?

episodes.title: Roger the Negotiator
episodes.plot: When a routine negotiation goes wrong, Rodger Smith quickly realizes that there is more to the situation than just your average kidnapping and is forced to call on Big O. It's Showtime.

episodes.title: Dorothy, Dorothy
episodes.plot: Dorothy is distraught after seeing the destruction of Dorothy-1 and flees the Big O base. She goes to see her father, Timothy Wayneright, as Roger attempts to deduce the girl's true nature.

episodes.title: Electric City
episodes.plot: Mysterious power outages have been happening all over the city. Roger is hired by Casey Jenkins to convince the people that isn't the work of some angry god do he can reactivate the hydroelectric plant.

episodes.title: Underground Terror
episodes.plot: Journalist Michael Seebach has been missing for three months and his secretary, Angel, hires Roger to find his missing manuscript. However, as Roger investigates, he learns there is more to the reporter than initially presumed.

episodes.title: Bring Back My Ghost
episodes.plot: In East Town, Roger is hired by an elderly and blind woman to find her son before her next birthday. Looking into it, Roger learns that the son died last year, but also that a ghost appears on the riverbank where he died.

episodes.title: A Legacy of Amadeus
episodes.plot: Dorothy has taken up the piano and keeps Roger awake with her terrible playing. To get some peace, he takes her to famous pianist R. Instro, whose father, Amadeus, ran a piano bar.

episodes.title: The Call from the Past
episodes.plot: The price of fish has skyrocketed, supposedly due to a titan that lives in the sea. Roger goes to investigate only to bump into Angel. As they explore beneath the water, they discover a city.

episodes.title: Missing Cat
episodes.plot: A dog suddenly turns into a monster and kills its owners before dying itself. Roger and Dorothy discover an abandoned cat named Pero, whom Dorothy grows attached to.

episodes.title: Beck Comes Back
episodes.plot: Beck escapes from prison and manages to get wrapped up in a case that Roger and Dorothy are involved in. Soon even the police get involved and things get even more complicated.

episodes.title: Winter Night Phantom
episodes.plot: A bomber is planting explosive toys all over town that cause destruction. The city government discusses what to do as a man named Dastun had visions of a ethereal woman in his dreams.

episodes.title: Daemonseed
episodes.plot: Heaven's Day, the day that the city was founded as well as Dorothy's birthday, is approaching. Roger takes a case to find a Daemonseed, an emerald egg that has wound up with a saxophone player.

episodes.title: Enemy Is Another Big!
episodes.plot: Schwarzwald, thought dead, suddenly reemerges piloting a giant robot of his own. Roger and Schwarzwald begin their final battle: Big O vs Big Duo.

episodes.title: R.D.
episodes.plot: An assassin stalks the city streets, leaving only a vague riddle as a calling card. Roger and Dastun investigate the happenings and get a lead that might hold dark secrets and memories long forgotten.
